text: Los Lobos (, Spanish for "the Wolves") is an American rock band from East Los Angeles, California. Their music is inspired by rock and roll, Tex-Mex, country, zydeco, folk, R&B;, blues, brown-eyed soul, and traditional music such as cumbia, boleros and norte√±os. They began well known in 1987, when their version of Ritchie Valens' "La Bamba" topped the charts in the U.S., the UK, and other countries. In 2015, they were nominated for the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame. They are also known for performing the theme song for Handy Manny. ==References== Category:Musical groups from Los Angeles
title: Los Lobos
